short_description: This function gives a predict label for each input sample according to the pre-trained model table.
long_description: The SparseSVMPredictor function takes the model output by the function SVMSparse and a set of test samples (in sparse format) and outputs a prediction for each sample. This function can be used with real-time applications. See AMLGenerator.

input_tables.name: model
input_tables.rDescription: The model table generated by SVMTrainer.
input_tables.description: The model table generated by SVMTrainer.

argument_clauses.name: AttributeNameColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the sample_table column that contains the attributes of the test samples.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the input column that contains the attributes of the test samples.

argument_clauses.name: IDColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the sample_table column that contains the identifiers of the test samples. The sample_table must be partitioned by this column.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the input column that contains the identifiers of the test samples. The sample_table must be partitioned by this column.

argument_clauses.name: AttributeValueColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the sample_table column that contains the attribute values. By default, each attribute has the value 1.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the input column that contains the attribute values. Default behavior: Each attribute has the value 1.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the sample_table columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the names of the input columns to copy to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: OutputClassNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Valid only for multiple-class models. Specifies the number of class labels to appear in the output table, with its corresponding prediction confidence. The default value is 1.
argument_clauses.description: Valid only for multiple-class models. Specify the number of class labels to appear in the output table, with its corresponding prediction confidence. Default: 1

argument_clauses.name: UniqueId
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
